item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Everyone knows your location: tracking myself down through in-app ads (732 points | 238 comments)
2. Waydroid – Android in a Linux container (125 points | 17 comments)
3. Emergence of a Second Law of Thermodynamics in Isolated Quantum Systems (21 points | 1 comment)
4. GarminDB (13 points | discuss)
5. ScatterBrain: Unmasking the shadow of PoisonPlug's obfuscator (47 points | 5 comments)
6. An open-source, extensible AI agent that goes beyond code suggestions (28 points | 9 comments)
7. The Legacy of Lies in Alzheimer's Science (48 points | 16 comments)
8. The dumb reason why flag emojis aren't working on your site in Chrome on Windows (109 points | 74 comments)
9. Costa Rican Supermarket Wins Trademark Battle Against Nintendo (16 points | 4 comments)
10. Show HN: Lume – OS lightweight CLI for MacOS and Linux VMs on Apple Silicon (215 points | 62 comments)
11. Reverse-engineering and analysis of SanDisk High Endurance microSDXC card (2020) (217 points | 92 comments)
12. Ask HN: What is interviewing like now with everyone using AI? (117 points | 144 comments)
13. Analyzing the codebase of Caffeine, a high performance caching library (182 points | 37 comments)
14. Hytradboi 2025 Program (6 points | discuss)
15. Don't make fun of renowned author Dan Brown (2013) (21 points | 5 comments)
16. Show HN: ESP32 RC Cars (247 points | 43 comments)
17. Spaced repetition can allow for infinite recall (2022) (125 points | 146 comments)
18. Macrodata Refinement (575 points | 298 comments)
19. A loophole used by Shein/Temu to ship packages to US tax-free (2024) (63 points | 44 comments)
20. Life is more than an engineering problem (293 points | 179 comments)
21. Show HN: Groundhog AI Spring API (43 points | 19 comments)
22. The PETG adhesive test [video] (46 points | 20 comments)
23. RLHF Book (392 points | 30 comments)
24. Sniffnet – monitor your Internet traffic (165 points | 68 comments)
25. UK betting giant's unlawful marketing kept suicidal gambler hooked (54 points | 44 comments)
26. AstroForge selects target for "high risk, seat of the pants" asteroid mission (93 points | 60 comments)
27. Why do War Thunder players leak classified information? [video] (54 points | 59 comments)
28. Fixing left and mutual recursions in grammars (95 points | 23 comments)
29. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (307 points | 245 comments)
30. Show HN: Modest – musical harmony library for Lua (59 points | 6 comments)
